properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibilities in blowing snow are expected in Naujaat beginning near midday today. Tucked between high pressure over NWT and low pressure to the east, northerly winds gusting up to 80 km/h will develop by early this afternoon. These strong gusts will help to produce blizzard conditions in Naujaat this afternoon. These conditions are expected to persist until Sunday afternoon. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T01:24:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T09:25:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0370661183.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A few hours of heavy wet snow expected. A cold front will move across the north coast today then across the central coast and Vancouver Island tonight. Heavy rain ahead of the front will quickly switch over to a period of heavy wet snow. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm will likely occur in a short period of time with higher amounts expected over higher terrain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T04:40:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T12:41:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4031347704.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Vancouver Island, Central Coast - coastal sections, Central Coast - inland sections, North Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An Arctic air mass combined with strong northwesterly winds will give wind chill values near -38 on Sunday morning. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T01:48:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T09:49:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1922291813.2021
Area: Waskaganish
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: As a low pressure system intensifies over northern Baffin Bay today, strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h will begin overnight tonight into Sunday morning. These winds combined with light snow could create hazardous blizzard conditions with low visibilities in blowing snow. Blowing snow is expected at times today as winds begin to increase. Please stay alert for updated bulletins and check local public forecasts for more information regarding the timing and strength of the winds. As the event draws nearer, this watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T01:22:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T09:23:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1383622115.2021
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-13T23:38:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-13T07:39:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1259507816.2021
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional snowfall: 2-4 cm in Nain to 10-15 cm in Makkovik. Maximum wind gusts: northerly up to 80 km/h. Locations: Nain to Makkovik. Time span: today and tonight. Remarks: Near-zero visibilities in white-out conditions are expected at times. Conditions will likely improve in Nain by this afternoon as the snow tapers off. Elsewhere, snow and blowing snow will continue into tonight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-14T01:11:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T09:12:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0899323413.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Additional snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay. Time span: persisting into Sunday. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds to produce poor visibility in blowing snow later this afternoon. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-14T00:58:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T08:59:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2688482813.2021
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 15-25 cm for Rigolet and Cartwright. 10-15 cm from Norman Bay to Lodge Bay. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Rigolet to Lodge Bay. Time span: Saturday morning until overnight Sunday. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds on Saturday to produce poor visibility in blowing snow. While strong winds will continue on Monday, the snow will taper off overnight Sunday night. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-13T18:47:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T02:48:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4248601470.2021
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR VERNON The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health has continued a Dust Advisory for Vernon because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Pacific front will remain nearly stationary over Haida Gwaii and the North Coast tonight bringing snow. 10 cm of snow is expected to fall before changing to mixed precipitation near midnight. Freezing levels will fall to near sea level again on Saturday as a cold front passes through the region. This can potentially bring another round of snowfall with further accumulations of 5 to 10 cm. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T22:09:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T06:10:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2568097581.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Additional snowfall: 10 to 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Rigolet to Black Tickle. Time span: persisting into Sunday. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds to produce poor visibility in blowing snow later today and tonight. Conditions will begin to improve on Sunday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A slow moving weather system will generate strong southeast winds of 90 km/h along exposed coastal sections of the Central Coast today. These winds will begin to ease early this evening as the system passes. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T04:36:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T12:37:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583949984.2021
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions continue. A slow moving weather system will continue to bring heavy snow today for Stewart and the surrounding areas. The temperatures will moderate slightly resulting in a rain and snow mix this afternoon. However, temperatures will become cooler tonight and snow will continue to fall. The snow will ease to scattered flurries this evening as the weather system finally moves through. Up to 20 cm of snow will fall today and tonight before the snow begins to ease. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T04:38:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-13T12:39:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1607893582.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds with gusts as high as 90 km/h will persist today and tonight. The strong winds are expected to continue into Sunday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-14T01:24:09-00:00

Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. Heavy snow is possible overnight with a further 5 to 10 cm. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A slow moving weather system will bring heavy rain to the Kitimat region today. Rainfall amounts in excess of 50 mm are expected before changing to snow this evening as temperatures lower. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system has spread snow into Dease Lake this evening. Snow will persist through Saturday as the system moves across northern BC. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
